headline: Attempted murder charges against Babu Owino dropped, but...
author: Richard Munguti
description: Embakasi East MP Babu Owino will pay the medical bills and expenses of the victim Felix Orinda
articleBody:
By & Joseph Wangui

Embakasi East MP Babu Owino has agreed to buy an apartment for the family of Mr Felix Orinda, popularly known as DJ Evolve; in exchange, attempted murder charges against him have been withdrawn.

By   &  Joseph Wangui

headline: Africa backs Ethiopia protest against UN human rights Council session
author: Aggrey Mutambo
description: Session meant to reprimand Addis Ababa’s alleged war atrocities in Tigray region.
articleBody: African countries have rallied behind Ethiopia in protesting against a planned special session at the UN Human Rights Council that was meant to reprimand Addis Ababa’s alleged war atrocities in the Tigray region.
articleBodyHtml: African countries have rallied behind Ethiopia in protesting against a planned special session at the UN Human Rights Council that was meant to reprimand Addis Ababa’s alleged war atrocities in the Tigray region.

headline: Driver dies, students injured as bus rolls in Murang'a
author: Mwangi Muiruri
description: Driver dies on the spot with injured students being taken to various nearby hospitals.
articleBody:
By & Reginah Kinogu

The driver of a bus carrying students died Tuesday while five learners were seriously injured when the vehicle rolled along the Gakungu-Kirimiri road in Murang'a South Sub-County.

headline: DR Congo lays elaborate table ahead of EAC admission
author: Patrick Ilunga
description: The DRC already shares borders with five EAC member countries.
articleBody: It is now old news that the Democratic Republic of Congo will become the seventh member of the East African Community. And following the endorsement by the bloc’s Council of Ministers, the second-highest organ of the EAC, the DRC is now preparing to welcome neighbours with whom it shares a linguistic and geographical connection.
articleBodyHtml: It is now old news that the Democratic Republic of Congo will become the seventh member of the East African Community. headline: Education level a major influence on jab uptake in Kenya
author: HEALTHY NATION TEAM
description: As Kenya struggles to increase the number of adults fully vaccinated against Covid-19, a number of barriers are slowing progress
articleBody:
What you need to know:

An individual’s level of education, the Ministry of Health data shows, has the strongest effect on willingness to get the vaccine.
On average, Kenyan adults with at least a bachelor’s degree view the vaccine as safe and effective than those with less education.

An analysis of Covid-19 vaccination rates in the country suggests one socio-economic factor, more than others, is correlated to vaccine uptake. And it is not income, language or cultural barriers.
articleBodyHtml:
What you need to know:

  • An individual’s level of education, the Ministry of Health data shows, has the strongest effect on willingness to get the vaccine.
  • On average, Kenyan adults with at least a bachelor’s degree view the vaccine as safe and effective than those with less education.

An analysis of Covid-19 vaccination rates in the country suggests one socio-economic factor, more than others, is correlated to vaccine uptake. And it is not income, language or cultural barriers.

headline: Combating gender-based violence during crises
author: Carol Werunga
description: Kenya has not yet set up mechanisms to address gender-based violence during crises.
articleBody: Whenever man-made crises or natural disasters occur, they usually lead to human suffering across social, and economic domains including escalations of violence against women and girls.

description: Some 32 people died when their hired bus slid into the flooded Enziu river

headline: Raila the billionaires’ candidate
author: Kennedy Chesoli
description: Raila Odinga stands for the status quo as a candidate and protector of the triple dynasty of the Kenyattas, Mois and Odingas
articleBody:
By

New York-based development economist and global policy expert.

Raila’s fifth run for presidency is turning out to be an anti-climax. The “enigma” has lost his mojo, and seems unable to cobble together a movement that could finally put him in the State House. No longer his own man, Raila is a fatigued billionaires’ candidate whose campaign is clearly stuck in a rut.
articleBodyHtml:
By

New York-based development economist and global policy expert.

Raila’s fifth run for presidency is turning out to be an anti-climax. The “enigma” has lost his mojo, and seems unable to cobble together a movement that could finally put him in the State House. No longer his own man, Raila is a fatigued billionaires’ candidate whose campaign is clearly stuck in a rut.

headline: Invest in health systems, Rwandan President Paul Kagame tells African leaders
author: Pauline Ongaji
description: President Paul Kagame says the uncertainty around Omicron variant proves the pandemic is far from over.
articleBody: Building a new efficient and strong public health order, was the key message at the inaugural International Conference on Public Health in Africa (CPHIA 2021).
articleBodyHtml: Building a new efficient and strong public health order, was the key message at the inaugural International Conference on Public Health in Africa (CPHIA 2021).
